IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) serving the interior of Alaska.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Cross Road Health Ministries, Inc. will show the love of the Lord Jesus Christ through accessible, quality health care.
IRS990.Desc: Cross Road Health Ministries, Inc., which operates Federally Qualified Health Centers in interior Alaska, provides quality medical care for the whole person to the maximum extent possible with available resources. The clinic saw 7,039 visitors and the pharmacy served 23,759 visitors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Schedule D, Part X, Line 2:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The financial statement effects of a tax position taken or expected to be taken are recognized in the financial statements when it is more likely than not, based on the technical merits, that the position will be sustained upon examination. Interest and penalties, if any, are included in expenses in the statements of activities. As of March 31, 2018 and 2017, CRHM had no uncertain tax positions that qualify for recognition or disclosure in the financial statements. CRHM files information tax returns in the U.S. and Alaska. CRHM is subject to income tax examinations for the current year and certain prior years based on the applicable laws and regulations. examinations for the current year and certain prior years based on the applicable laws and regulations.
Also Doing Business As: Cross Road Pharmacy Interior Alaska Medical Clinic Interior ALaska Pharmacy

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has an executive committee with the authority to act on behalf of the full Board when the Board is not in session, All actions on behalf of the Organization will be reported at the next meeting of the Board, with a Quorum present, for ratification, The executive committee is made up of the CEO, Board Secretary, Board Treasurer, Board Chair, Board Vice-Chair, and one Board member.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Sharon Daniel, Board Chair is the daughter of Carol Neeley, Board Vice-Treasurer. Additionally, they own a local sanitation company that provides services to the organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Form 990 was prepared by an independent CPA firm and was reviewed in detail by the CEO, CFO and Finance Committee. A complete copy of the Form 990 was then forwarded to the full Board before filing with the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Cross Road board members officers and employees must disclose annually any interests that could give rise to conflict. The conflict of interest policy is monitored on an annual basis by the Board of Directors. Board/Senior Leadership: Upon installation and thereafter annually, the Board Members, Chief Executive Officer and Chief Operating Officer (if applicable) shall complete a conflict of interest form and submit it to the Director of Human Resources for review and inclusion in their personnel file. The Board of Directors will resolve any conflicts of interest with respect to Board Members, the Chief Executive Officer, and Chief Operating Officer. The Board shall confer with legal counsel prior to waiving any material conflict of interest. Employees/Volunteers/Agents: Director of Accounting (CFO) reviews conflict of interest forms received and advises employees, volunteers, and agents regarding potential conflicts, and monitors those activities with potential conflicts, as necessary. A conflict of interest may not be waived without the approval of the Chief Executive Officer. The Chief Executive Officer shall confer with legal counsel prior to waiving any material conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors annually reviews the compensation for the CEO. The CEO reviews and compiles compensation data on all other employees annually and submits to the Board of Directors for confirmation. Comparability data is used when setting compensation for all employees. The compensation process for all is documented in the minutes. is used when setting compensation for all employees. The compensation process for all is documented in the minutes.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request.
